EmailTemplate.subject: We Want to Share a Few Secrets with You
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Ready to plan for what’s next—even amid all the uncertainty? By using your imagination and being flexible, you can experiment with adaptive strategies to create new sources of revenue when you need it most.
In this newsletter, we’ve got the resources and training tips to inspire you—and help you develop short and long-term creative strategies. Resources to help you thrive Latest COVID-19 updated informationThe National Restaurant Association <[[https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/operations/state-state-guide-covid-19-resources-food-beverage-industries]]> has important COVID-19 updates, including emergency relief funds, rent assistance programs, and an inspiring “Lift Your Spirits” fund that helps to build a sense of community in the restaurant industry. Read more <[[https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/operations/state-state-guide-covid-19-resources-food-beverage-industries]]>Using social media to keep customers engagedLoyal customers want to support local businesses. There’s no better time than this holiday season to amplify your social media presence and let your customers know about any family meal menu items and promotions you’re running. Check out this article with six easy-to-implement social media strategies, “How your restaurant can run a successful social media campaign.” <[[https://www.ncr.com/blogs/restaurants/how-your-restaurant-can-run-a-successful-social-media-campaign]]> Training opportunities Restaurant Recovery SummitThe Restaurant Recovery Summit is offering more than 30 virtual webinars now through January 2021 with at least 40 leading restaurateurs sharing how they’re weathering the pandemic and the best practices they’ve discovered. Learn more <[[https://restaurantrecoverysummit.com/]]>How casual dining is navigating month 8 of the pandemicThis free on-demand workshop explores the coping skills that are working for casual-dining operations, even if they lack the resources of big brands. Learn more <[[https://www.bigmarker.com/winsight/How-casual-dining-is-navigating-Month-8-of-the-pandemic?utm_bmcr_source=RBO]]>Reshaping the guest experienceCheck out a recording of our latest NCR webinar, “Reshaping the Guest Experience” <[[https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/u4788348.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=RA5k1pJxRyOPl6cXG2PRncCySQwgddNr4Hrs0goms-2BQHy6pXVc-2F7Qx1NTgX-2B2BrISUHU-2FLddVpYFPAdIRFKFPIAQPjVHeNFjFwchQRxMnb4UG-2BmBSDA1-2F8qbUmKxKKDZzv4re-2F8lOH8aQEnyvuHfWvK4FI2FXmr4MF-2BOOu2s6YlV8i5omZlqGiUrLVHvwn-2BXHy-2FUuKr5olJieeHZBGBlP74VmNZvWbkbyHFs-2FnXNRB2ifPW9nPKMmWA-2BY6YIBtAhvQTG_Fsz1v24zetQhy3kbmRoizNYOScpB31HkdDagYzKHxC-2FxcDEMpNOSi6VufzraLSN9VQmTD7T9P9RBdhAubyobeXJUrXsACE1ph-2BARpW102bg8Lgm-2FpS55ZM-2B8wJNY0xlprmMvUYpAVeGYkmWq-2FqWu-2FvMTfg88z73MZvo3a9RHiN8gFst5mQQ5KgcBhgy7Yi7SfuB0nyiNpvVaGYIqjGqSQoQ9s7ldc8K-2FSvAXqcJnDo1BoVc3-2B7uh7Tjp31NPJQLKWM8w72A121O6pI9lQjGCjoK6WMOxsRYvsMiiEWJuw3N-2B7JP-2FqRYVVNCRwGCFMeBr__;!!In4Qlw!4_Fw1xeDfNF4KOAd8qY4TI56HVfV6jBjyHgEKEhKD3WwU5oo4xlYDnM2Pe8EEMTZ$]]> to hear about three proven strategies—Customer Re-Engagement, Safe Experiences, and Restaurant Redesign to address shifting guest expectations and preferences. Additional resources to help you run your business
Are you meeting transformation head-on? <[[https://www.ncr.com/blogs/restaurants/restaurant-transformation-redesigning-your-guest-experience]]> – To keep your guests coming back, stay up to date on the adjustments required to meet changing consumer expectations and safety concerns.Is your contactless food delivery good enough? <[[https://www.ncr.com/blogs/restaurants/contactless-food-delivery]]> – We outline important tips to help you meet delivery demands.. 9 ways restaurant tech can be your expo for off-premise ordering success <[[https://www.ncr.com/content/dam/web/infographics/9_Ways_to_RestaurantTech_Success.pdf]]> – Take control to ensure your brand promise reaches your off-premise customers.Is your customer loyalty program really customer focused? <[[https://www.ncr.com/blogs/restaurants/is-your-customer-loyalty-program-really-customer-focused]]> – Customers want to be recognized, understood and motivated, and it’s important to demonstrate that you know what they care about.
